game.name: Connect 4 Twist & Turn
game.history: Connect Four Twist and Turn is a modern variant of the classic Connect Four, released by Hasbro. Its key innovation is the introduction of rotating columns, which dramatically changes positional tactics and increases game-tree complexity compared to the standard version.
game.board: A standard Connect Four grid (vertical, 4x4 or 4x5), but each entire column can be rotated 90° when the player chooses the “twist” action. Rotation shifts the alignment of pieces but does not cause pieces to fall, creating dynamic board states.
game.pieces: Both sides have the same number of pieces as the grid. Pieces are placed into the top of any column (classic gravity mechanic).
game.tomove: On your turn, you drop a piece and, optionally, rotate any one row.
game.towin: First player to create a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal line of 4 pieces of their color wins.

strategy.name: Momentum Control Through Rotation
strategy.description: By rotating, you can disrupt your opponent's three-in-a-row chances or create your own potential four-in-a-row. A single rotation can often create a sudden opportunity, and even directly lead to a winning situation.

strategy.name: Column Commitment Punish
strategy.description: If your opponent stacks multiple pieces in a certain column, by rotating that column at the right moment, you can disperse their arrangement, rendering their previous efforts in vain.

variant.name: 4x4
variant.description: A board with 4 rows and 4 columns.

variant.name: 4x5
variant.description: A board with 4 rows and 5 columns.
